meanings.definition: A person who holds a title or championship in a sport or competition.
meanings.sent1: The titlist proudly displayed the trophy he won in the race.
meanings.sent2: The tennis titlist celebrated her victory with a joyful dance.
meanings.sent3: The young titlist pretended to be a champion by wearing a toy medal around his neck.
meanings.sent4: She was the titlist of the spelling bee, reigning supreme over all other contestants.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered loudly for the titlist as he raised the championship belt in triumph.

meanings.definition: A publication or work that lists titles or headings.
meanings.sent1: The library catalog was a helpful titlist for finding books on specific topics.
meanings.sent2: The magazine's titlist made it easy to navigate through the different articles.
meanings.sent3: The titlist of the newspaper helped readers quickly locate the latest news.
meanings.sent4: In the index, the titlist guided readers to the relevant sections of the book.
meanings.sent5: The online database served as a titlist for researchers looking for academic papers.
